reference.title: ETM register summary
reference.shortdesc: This section summarizes the ETM trace unit registers.

section.p: All ETM trace unit registers are 32-bit wide. The description of each register includes its offset from a base address. The base address is defined by the system integrator when placing the trace unit in the Debug-APB memory map.
The following table lists all of the trace unit registers.

entry.xref: TRCPRGCTLR, Programming Control RegisterThe TRCPRGCTLR enables the trace unit.
TRCSTATR, Status RegisterThe TRCSTATR indicates the trace unit status.
TRCCONFIGR, Trace Configuration RegisterThe TRCCONFIGR controls the tracing options.
TRCAUXCTLR, Auxiliary Control RegisterThe TRCAUXCTLR provides implementation defined configuration and control options.

EventControl0Register" type="reference">TRCEVENTCTL0R, Control 0 RegisterThe TRCEVENTCTL0R controls the tracing of events in the trace stream. The events also drive the external outputs from the trace unit. The events are selected from the Resource Selectors.
TRCEVENTCTL1R, Control 1 RegisterThe TRCEVENTCTL1R controls the behavior of the events that TRCEVENTCTL0R selects.
TRCSTALLCTLR, Stall Control RegisterThe TRCSTALLCTLR enables the trace unit to stall the Cortex‑A76 core if the trace unit FIFO overflows.

TRCTSCTLR, Global Timestamp Control RegisterThe TRCTSCTLR controls the insertion of global timestamps in the trace streams. When the selected event is triggered, the trace unit inserts a global timestamp into the trace streams. The event is selected from one of the Resource Selectors.
TRCSYNCPR, Synchronization Period RegisterThe TRCSYNCPR controls how often periodic trace synchronization requests occur.
TRCCCCTLR, Cycle Count Control RegisterThe TRCCCCTLR sets the threshold value for cycle counting.
TRCBBCTLR, Branch Broadcast Control RegisterThe TRCBBCTLR controls how branch broadcasting behaves, and allows branch broadcasting to be enabled for certain memory regions.
TRCTRACEIDR, Trace ID RegisterThe TRCTRACEIDR sets the trace ID for instruction trace.
TRCVICTLR, ViewInst Main Control RegisterThe TRCVICTLR controls instruction trace filtering.
TRCVIIECTLR, ViewInst Include-Exclude Control RegisterThe TRCVIIECTLR defines the address range comparators that control the ViewInst Include/Exclude control.
TRCVISSCTLR, ViewInst Start-Stop Control RegisterThe TRCVISSCTLR defines the single address comparators that control the ViewInst Start/Stop logic.

TRCSEQEVRn, Sequencer State Transition Control Registers 0-2The TRCSEQEVRn defines the sequencer transitions that progress to the next state or backwards to the previous state. The trace unit implements a sequencer state machine with up to four states.

TRCSEQEVRn, Sequencer State Transition Control Registers 0-2The TRCSEQEVRn defines the sequencer transitions that progress to the next state or backwards to the previous state. The trace unit implements a sequencer state machine with up to four states.

TRCSEQEVRn, Sequencer State Transition Control Registers 0-2The TRCSEQEVRn defines the sequencer transitions that progress to the next state or backwards to the previous state. The trace unit implements a sequencer state machine with up to four states.
TRCSEQRSTEVR, Sequencer Reset Control RegisterThe TRCSEQRSTEVR resets the sequencer to state 0.
TRCSEQSTR, Sequencer State RegisterThe TRCSEQSTR holds the value of the current state of the sequencer.

TRCEXTINSELR, External Input Select RegisterThe TRCEXTINSELR controls the selectors that choose an external input as a resource in the trace unit. You can use the Resource Selectors to access these external input resources.
TRCCNTRLDVRn, Counter Reload Value Registers 0-1The TRCCNTRLDVRn define the reload value for the counter.
TRCCNTRLDVRn, Counter Reload Value Registers 0-1The TRCCNTRLDVRn define the reload value for the counter.
TRCCNTCTLR0, Counter Control Register 0The TRCCNTCTLR0 controls the counter.
TRCCNTCTLR1, Counter Control Register 1The TRCCNTCTLR1 controls the counter.
TRCCNTVRn, Counter Value Registers 0-1The TRCCNTVRn contain the current counter value.
TRCCNTVRn, Counter Value Registers 0-1The TRCCNTVRn contain the current counter value.
TRCIDR8, ID Register 8The TRCIDR8 returns the maximum speculation depth of the instruction trace stream.
TRCIDR9, ID Register 9The TRCIDR9 returns the number of P0 right-hand keys that the trace unit can use.
TRCIDR10, ID Register 10The TRCIDR10 returns the number of P1 right-hand keys that the trace unit can use.
TRCIDR11, ID Register 11The TRCIDR11 returns the number of special P1 right-hand keys that the trace unit can use.
TRCIDR12, ID Register 12The TRCIDR12 returns the number of conditional instruction right-hand keys that the trace unit can use.
TRCIDR13, ID Register 13The TRCIDR13 returns the number of special conditional instruction right-hand keys that the trace unit can use.
TRCIMSPEC0, Implementation Specific Register 0The TRCIMSPEC0 shows the presence of any implementation specific features, and enables any features that are provided.
TRCIDR0, ID Register 0The TRCIDR0 returns the tracing capabilities of the trace unit.
TRCIDR1, ID Register 1The TRCIDR1 returns the base architecture of the trace unit.
TRCIDR2, ID Register 2The TRCIDR2 returns the maximum size of six parameters in the trace unit.
TRCIDR3, ID Register 3The TRCIDR3 indicates:
TRCIDR4, ID Register 4The TRCIDR4 indicates the resources available in the trace unit.
TRCIDR5, ID Register 5The TRCIDR5 returns how many resources the trace unit supports.

row.entry: TRCRSCTLRn, Resource Selection Control Registers 2-16The TRCRSCTLRn controls the trace resources. There are eight resource pairs, the first pair is predefined as {0,1,pair=0} and having reserved select registers. This leaves seven pairs to be implemented as programmable selectors., n is 2, 15

entry.xref: TRCSSCCR0, Single-Shot Comparator Control Register 0The TRCSSCCR0 controls the single-shot comparator.
TRCSSCSR0, Single-Shot Comparator Status Register 0The TRCSSCSR0 indicates the status of the single-shot comparator. TRCSSCSR0 is sensitive to instruction addresses.
TRCOSLAR, OS Lock Access RegisterThe TRCOSLAR sets and clears the OS Lock, to lock out external debugger accesses to the trace unit registers.
TRCOSLSR, OS Lock Status RegisterThe TRCOSLSR returns the status of the OS Lock.
TRCPDCR, Power Down Control RegisterThe TRCPDCR request to the system power controller to keep the trace unit powered up.
TRCPDSR, Power Down Status RegisterThe TRCPDSR indicates the power down status of the trace unit.
TRCACVRn, Address Comparator Value Registers 0-7The TRCACVRn indicate the address for the address comparators.
TRCACATRn, Address Comparator Access Type Registers 0-7The TRCACATRn control the access for the corresponding address comparators.
TRCCIDCVR0, Context ID Comparator Value Register 0The TRCCIDCVR0 contains a Context ID value.
TRCVMIDCVR0, VMID Comparator Value Register 0The TRCVMIDCVR0 contains a VMID value.
TRCCIDCCTLR0, Context ID Comparator Control Register 0The TRCCIDCCTLR0 controls the mask value for the context ID comparators.
TRCVMIDCCTLR0, Virtual context identifier Comparator Control Register 0The TRCVMIDCCTLR0 contains the Virtual machine identifier mask value for the TRCVMIDCVR0 register.
TRCITIDR, Integration Identification RegisterThe TRCITIDR sets the state of output pins, mentioned in the bit descriptions in this section.
TRCITIDATAR, Integration Instruction Data RegisterThe TRCITIDATAR sets the state of the ATDATAMn output pins shown in the TRCITIDATAR bit assignments table.
TRCITIINR, Integration Instruction In RegisterThe TRCITIINR reads the state of the input pins described in this section.
TRCITIOUTR, Integration Instruction Out RegisterThe TRCITIOUTR sets the state of the output pins mentioned in the bit descriptions in this section.
TRCITCTRL, Integration Mode Control RegisterThe TRCITCTRL enables topology detection or integration testing, by putting the trace unit into integration mode.
TRCCLAIMSET, Claim Tag Set RegisterThe TRCCLAIMSET sets bits in the claim tag and determines the number of claim tag bits implemented.
TRCCLAIMCLR, Claim Tag Clear RegisterThe TRCCLAIMCLR clears bits in the claim tag and determines the current value of the claim tag.

TRCDEVAFF0, Device Affinity Register 0The TRCDEVAFF0 provides an additional identification mechanism for scheduling purposes in a cluster. TRCDEVAFF0 is a -only copy of MPIDR accessible from the external debug interface.
TRCDEVAFF1, Device Affinity Register 1The TRCDEVAFF1 is a -only copy of MPIDR_EL1[63:32] as seen from EL3, unaffected by VMPIDR_EL2.
TRCLAR, Software Lock Access RegisterThe TRCLAR controls access to registers using the memory-mapped interface, when PADDRDBG31 is LOW.
TRCLSR, Software Lock Status RegisterThe TRCLSR determines whether the software lock is implemented, and indicates the current status of the software lock.
TRCAUTHSTATUS, Authentication Status RegisterThe TRCAUTHSTATUS indicates the current level of tracing permitted by the system.
TRCDEVARCH, Device Architecture RegisterThe TRCDEVARCH identifies the trace unit as an v4 component.
TRCDEVID, Device ID RegisterThe TRCDEVID indicates the capabilities of the trace unit.
TRCDEVTYPE, Device Type RegisterThe TRCDEVTYPE indicates the type of the component.
TRCPIDR0, Peripheral Identification Register 0The TRCPIDR0 provides information to identify a trace component.
TRCPIDR1, Peripheral Identification Register 1The TRCPIDR1 provides information to identify a trace component.
TRCPIDR2, Peripheral Identification Register 2The TRCPIDR2 provides information to identify a trace component.
TRCPIDR3, Peripheral Identification Register 3The TRCPIDR3 provides information to identify a trace component.
TRCPIDR4, Peripheral Identification Register 4The TRCPIDR4 provides information to identify a trace component.
TRCPIDRn, Peripheral Identification Registers 5-7No information is held in the Peripheral ID5, Peripheral ID6, and Peripheral ID7 Registers.
TRCCIDR0, Component Identification Register 0The TRCCIDR0 provides information to identify a trace component.
TRCCIDR1, Component Identification Register 1The TRCCIDR1 provides information to identify a trace component.
TRCCIDR2, Component Identification Register 2The TRCCIDR2 provides information to identify a CTI component.
TRCCIDR3, Component Identification Register 3The TRCCIDR3 provides information to identify a trace component.
